title: 820-3662 doesn't charge the battery
message:
Hi!
There was spill in the U7100 and U7501 area, so I replaced the two ICs and some components around them. Now the macbook can start and work (fans spin very fast), but it does not charge and puts "repair" in the battery state. The charger led blinks green twice, stays steady for 1 second and blinks twice again.

PS: I also tried two batteries and same result.

title: 820-3662 doesn't charge the battery
message:
Tried known good battery?

Check voltage and diode mode to ground at SCL/SDA lines.
Post exact PPBUS_G3H voltage w/ and w/o battery connected?
Run corresponding EFI ASD test.
Check R7150/51/52 and traces; also check SMC_CHGR_BMON_ISENSE level.

title: 820-3662 doesn't charge the battery
message:
SCL = 3.40V
SDA = 3.40V
PPBUS_G3H W= 10.80V
PPBUS_G3H W/O = 19.54V

EFI ASD = tomorrow (I'm downloading the files).

R7151 = 2.8 ohms
R7152 = 0.8 ohms
SMC_CHGR_BMON_ISENSE = 45k / 0V

title: 820-3662 doesn't charge the battery
message:
"PPBUS_G3H W/O = 19.54V"
If this means PPBUS_G3H without battery (only charger), Q7130 is shorted; change it asap.
Be sure C7125 is good.

title: 820-3662 doesn't charge the battery
message:
I have injected V = 1V into PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR and R7021 / 2 was getting hot: I changed the resistors, changed Q7130 but it still doesn't charge the battery (R7021 / 2 no longer gets hot).

With thermal camera, Q7130 heats up with charger and charger + battery.

title: 820-3662 doesn't charge the battery
message: Did you think to check actual PPBUS_G3H voltage???

title: 820-3662 doesn't charge the battery
message: PPBUS_G3H = 19.20V.

title: 820-3662 doesn't charge the battery
message:
Doesn't look to high for you?
Change Q7130...

title: 820-3662 doesn't charge the battery
message: I have changed it 3 times but it remains the same, it doesn't charge the battery and it gets hot (Q7130).

title: 820-3662 doesn't charge the battery
message:
Did you check PPBUS_G3H each time?
Be sure Q7130 Gate pin has good contact with U7100.
Also check/replace C7125; its traces good?

title: 820-3662 doesn't charge the battery
message: Thanks to [USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER]  for the information: I have managed to get ppbus to be correct (12.58V) and to charge but, I still have problems: when turning on the macbook, the battery appears after 1-2 minutes of logging in (charger connected) and when I disconnect the charger, it keeps marking as if it was charging.

title: 820-3662 doesn't charge the battery
message:
Did you try known good battery?
Check SMC_BC_ACOK when charger is disconnected; only battery present.

title: 820-3662 doesn't charge the battery
message:
Yes, it's a new battery with 1 charge cycle.

- SMC_BC_ACOK = 0V.

title: 820-3662 doesn't charge the battery
message:
Yes, it's a new battery with 1 charge cycle.

SMC_BC_ACOK = 0V (battery connected only).

title: 820-3662 doesn't charge the battery
message:
New chinese battery?
You've said tried two more batterires; was any known good?

title: 820-3662 doesn't charge the battery
message:
Newertech battery.

Yes, I have an "old original" battery and this new one.

title: 820-3662 doesn't charge the battery
message:
And known good one has exact the same behavior?
Did you try another original Magsafe 2 charger?

title: 820-3662 doesn't charge the battery
message:
Yes, it recognizes it after 1-2 minutes of logging in.
With the new battery, I can turn on the macbook but still, it recognizes it after 1-2 minutes and even if I charge it, the percentage doesn't change (I look at the information about the remaining charge and after a few minutes, I check again).

Yes, I have tried with another original magsafe 2 and same behavior.

title: 820-3662 doesn't charge the battery
message:
Remove internal SSD and try another USB macOS.
Or try with the SSD from another working machine.

Do PRAM reset 2-3 times.
Actual PPBUS_G3H, without battery?

title: 820-3662 doesn't charge the battery
message:
I finally changed the SMC and the battery issues were fixed.

It can be marked as repaired and thank [USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER]
